meanings.definition: Wamblier (adjective): comparative form of wambly, meaning more unsteady or shaky
meanings.sent1: The old bridge was wamblier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: She felt wamblier after the long hike.
meanings.sent3: The wamblier jelly on the plate jiggled comically.
meanings.sent4: His confidence grew wamblier with each step he took.
meanings.sent5: The wamblier ground beneath their feet made them stumble.

meanings.definition: Wamblier (adverb): in a more unsteady or shaky manner
meanings.sent1: She walked wamblier on the icy sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The tree swayed wamblier in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The dancer moved wamblier than a leaf in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: His voice trembled wamblier as he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The boat rocked wamblier as the storm approached.

meanings.definition: Wamblier (noun): a person or thing that is more unsteady or shaky
meanings.sent1: The toddler was a wamblier compared to his older sister.
meanings.sent2: The wamblier of the two vases fell and shattered.
meanings.sent3: The wamblier in the group struggled to keep up.
meanings.sent4: She avoided being near the wamblier on the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The wamblier of the branches couldn't bear the weight of the snow.
